title: What is this disgusting thing on the Tube?
text:
It’s enough to put you off your journey home (Picture: Mitten d’Amour)

It’s fair to say that sometimes the London Underground can be a pretty disgusting place.

We’ve all seen the videos of people hitting the dust out of the seats for starters.

But today a mysterious and disgusting stowaway was photographed on the Jubilee line – and commuters are more than horrified.

An image of the offending unidentified gloop was shared on Twitter by social media manager Mitten d’Amour.

Captioning the image to her followers, she wrote: ‘No single greater crime against the people of London shall be committed this day. We are in the presence of pure evil.’

No single greater crime against the people of London shall be committed this day. We are in the presence of pure evil. pic.twitter.com/tNBPWSl8z6 — Mitten d'Amour (@MittenDAmour) October 15, 2019

She told Metro.co.uk that she hoped the substance was chewing gum, adding that someone else had seemingly already ‘put their hand in it’ during their travels.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Others shared her horror, with one responding to the picture: ‘Jubilee line? That’s actual treason.’

Another asked: ‘Is it jizz?’, while a third commented: ‘Dirty b*****ds’.

A fourth joked: ‘We’re much more civilised here in Devonshire. It would be cider remnants.’

Last year there were over 800 separate incidents of trains being delayed because the trains had become unacceptably dirty.

The Jubilee line came second in the list, with 113 incidents recorded, while the Northern line nabbed the top spot with 221 instances alone.

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: A mysterious and disgusting stowaway was photographed on the Jubilee line - and commuters are more than horrified.
